page.title: 08Battery Unit
page.content: For 34 years Hestover Farm has been a dairy and battery unit run by one of the farming families in Baltonsborough Altogether they have 4000 hens which are all called Lucy. All of the hens are brown except for one white one. About 1860 eggs are produced each day and they are sold both locally and nationally through supermarkets. The eggs are graded according to weight by a mechanical grader. The hens are kept in 2 barns holding 2000 poulets or hens in each. Because of the importance of keeping a constant temperature in the battery, there is a stand-by generator.
